HQ:

  • Introduce Wendy

    • Girl in your house taking snacks
    • Rude

  • Sharon

    • Handler in the office
    • Possible fight

    • Argue with wendy

      • Wendy wants to go fight crime

      • Sharon thinks it's too dangerous

        • It actually is because Wendy's last team was murdered

  • Add Switchgear (They/Them)

    • Very chill
    • Your Handler in the Field

Chinatown:

  • Give Kris spending Money

    • It's a collection Sharon opened

  • All bodies must be present

  • Leave at 8pm

  • Helio - being followed, has telepathy

    • Jack, love interest

      • He feels left out, alienated, doesn't understand other people
      • Sees you and for the first time in a while, thinks he could be happy.
      • You'd both be different, but together.

  • Nullpoint - has a headache, needs to take care of it

    • Coffee shop - cozy, prompt cosmic awareness

      • This sensation feels a lot like when you're in your sanctuary
      • But instead of a pull, you feel it pushing something at you. Like, intrusive thoughts.

    • Sanctuary - more lore, deter

      • Valuable stuff, but using it progresses your doom
      • It isn't going to provide the comfort you seek
      • Maw of Syzyg demands something from you to bargain

  • Velocitron Toy

    • Show was amazing, had so much depth, people don't understand.
    • Turtle Tamer shows up, hangs out, tries to connect
    • TT tries to isolate a party member
    • Elthalpy could use powers to free Velocitron

  • Tailor / Lycra World

    • Pulls you in
    • Has you try stuff on
    • Nonsufficient Funds
    • Fights you

  • Arpeggio - Compelled to perform

    • Accordion Thief crashes the performance

    • Option to put him through a table

      • If yes: collateral damage to jeweler

  • Newborn - Botanist

    • Teenagers trash the place.

Enthalpy

  • Various prompts to out himself, reveal powers.

Wendy - Date

  • Go to a nice Italian restaurant
  • She spits out a meatball

Absolutely—here are 10 crisp, contestable Lessons you can teach the Newborn in Chinatown this session. Each is phrased like something an adult or teammate might say, designed to be true enough to follow but flawed enough to cause drama—perfect for Masks. I’ve paired each with where to trigger it, who might teach it, and what happens if they follow it literally vs. challenge it, plus hooks to your specific PCs/NPCs.

Use 3–4 on-screen and bank the rest. Let adults (Sharon/Switchgear), peers (Wendy), or the city itself teach them. When the Newborn follows a Lesson to the letter and it causes trouble, spotlight consequences and Labels/Influence. When they challenge one, let that strain relationships—play to find out.

1) “All bodies stay together.”

Where: Side streets as the crowd forms; Switchgear wanders off; fans pull Arpeggio away.
Taught by: Switchgear (“We roll as one.”)
Follow literally: They refuse to split to save someone → miss a time‑sensitive rescue.
Challenge it: They peel off with Wendy → Sharon brings consequences.
Hooks: Arpeggio’s fans (Fiddle Fiends) physically tug him away; Turtle Tamer tries to isolate someone; The Director loves to cut the team into panels.

2) “Never go inside someone’s mind or body without consent.”

Where: Helio’s telepathy buzz; selfie swarm; a panicking civilian.
Taught by: Helio (and Jack, by example).
Follow literally: They won’t scan a bystander who’s clearly compromised → ambush lands.
Challenge it: They probe someone to ‘help’ → headlines about invasive powers; Sharon’s paperwork.
Hooks: Jack opens up at street level; Helio models boundaries; later ties to outing/secret-ID tensions.

3) “Safety before spectacle.”

Where: Pop-up stage forms around Arpeggio; phones everywhere.
Taught by: Sharon…while pointedly staring at Arpeggio.
Follow literally: They shut down Arpeggio’s impromptu set → audience turns ugly; Arpeggio bristles.
Challenge it: They lean into the show → Accordion Thief crashes; collateral at the jeweler.
Hooks: Arpeggio’s Time for the Show impulses vs. public optics; The Director exploits either choice.

4) “Property can be replaced; people can’t.”

Where: Hot‑oil spill, noodle nets, storefront scuffles; the jeweler’s case.
Taught by: Wendy (earnest), or Switchgear (pragmatic).
Follow literally: They suplex a villain through a display → AEGIS billing and bad press.
Challenge it: They protect the shop, let a goon escape with a hostage → moral hangover.
Hooks: Accordion Thief taunts them from behind the jeweler; Sharon’s PIP after the dust settles.

5) “Obey the plan…until you must break it to save someone.”

Where: Curfew/return order: “All bodies present. Leave at 8pm.”
Taught by: Switchgear (they/them).
Follow literally: They pull out right at 8:00 → someone (Wendy? a civilian?) is left in harm’s way.
Challenge it: They overstay → reinforcements trap them; clinic fallout.
Hooks: Sets up a gut‑check moment for leadership; perfect for team argument scenes.

6) “Money isn’t love or permission.”

Where: Sharon’s envelope to Kris; Lycra World (Nonsufficient Funds); toy store hype.
Taught by: Sharon (transactional), contrasted by peers (relational).
Follow literally: They try to fix harm by “paying for it” → card declines; escalation with staff.
Challenge it: They refuse to spend on themselves or others → teammates feel dismissed; Kris bristles.
Hooks: Tailor/Lycra World scene turns tense; Casshan can offer a pragmatic fix vs. a human one.

7) “If someone tries to isolate you, call for a teammate.”

Where: Turtle Tamer pulls a PC into an alley; Director’s ‘solo shot’ framing.
Taught by: Wendy (burned by a past team), or Switchgear.
Follow literally: They hesitate to engage one‑on‑one → TT slips away with intel.
Challenge it: They follow alone → classic ambush, condition hits, or leverage captured.
Hooks: Great for the Newborn learning how to ‘call’ (“Team, I need you!”); strengthens bonds.

8) “Anger is information, not instruction.”

Where: Wendy’s rudeness; Nullpoint’s headache; shopkeeper snapping about broken displays.
Taught by: Helio (naming emotions), or Jack (disarmingly literal empathy).
Follow literally: They acknowledge feelings and choose not to escalate → de‑escalation scene.
Challenge it: They treat anger as threat → shove, flare, or “power as first resort,” cue backlash.
Hooks: Gives Nullpoint room to step away for self‑care; offers the Newborn a Comfort/Support beat.

9) “Ask first; then act fast.”

Where: Crowd control choices, hot stoves, blocked exits, “Who’s in charge here?”
Taught by: Casshan (diagnose before cut), or Switchgear (quick assessment).
Follow literally: They stop to ask in a split‑second crisis → someone gets burned; guilt.
Challenge it: They leap without asking → save the day but misread a boundary; social fallout.
Hooks: Lets Casshan mentor them (procedural know‑how) vs. Arpeggio’s instinctive flair.

10) “Retreat is a tactic, not a failure.”

Where: When injuries mount; clinic route opens; the clock hits 7:59.
Taught by: Sharon (risk aversion) or Wendy (hard‑won experience).
Follow literally: They call a retreat early → villain escapes; team frustration.
Challenge it: They refuse to withdraw → clinic fight later is nastier; conditions pile on.
Hooks: Sets up Scenario C cleanly; spotlights who the Newborn will listen to in a crunch.

Bonus quick prompts (swap‑ins or add‑ons)

  • “Secrets belong to the person, not the keeper.” (Don’t ‘out’ a hero to the crowd.)

  • “Say what you need out loud.” (Nullpoint asks for quiet; Newborn learns boundaries.)

  • “You can’t save everyone—choose who you save on purpose.” (Hard moral fork during chaos.)

How to deploy in play

  • Voice of the city: Let shop signs, PSAs, or bystanders say a Lesson first; then have an adult echo it.

  • Teachable moments: When the Newborn acts, ask: “Is that because you believe X?” If yes, push consequences.

  • Labels & Influence: When a Lesson causes friction, spotlight who’s shifting the Newborn’s Labels and why.

  • Tie to clocks: “Leave at 8pm” + “Retreat is a tactic” → turn the clock into a character.

If you want, I can condense these into a one‑page Lesson Card you can hand the Newborn player (with blanks to check “followed” or “challenged” this session).
